other_tests.findings: Several well-circumscribed echogenic round lesions in both lobes of the liver, three on the left and two on the right. The largest lesion measures 1.6 x 1.3 x 1.2 cm in the right lobe. These lesions do not demonstrate internal vascularity, and there is no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilation.
A 5cm mass in the bladder with surrounding edema, suspicious for transitional cell cancer.
Gastritis, duodenitis, 2 colon polyps, and sigmoid diverticulosis with suspicion for an extrinsic process.

Marked thickening and soft tissue signal involving the sigmoid colon, measuring 8.3x5.0cm; a necrotic lymph node in the sigmoid mesentery; lobulated lesion in the bladder measuring 6.8x5.4cm; a large lesion in the left hepatic lobe, measuring 8.2x6.5cm, with possible underlying thrombus.
